sicsim.utils
Class RandomSet

java.lang.Object
  sicsim.utils.RandomSet

public class RandomSet
extends java.lang.Object

Class to get random numbers within an interval. The class is specifically designed to generate unique random numbers within a small interval. For simulating p2p systems, this property is required to generate identifiers for nodes.

contains

public boolean contains(int v)
Check if a number has already been generated

Parameters:
v - number to check
Returns:
true if already generated, false otherwise

addInt

public int addInt()
           throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
Get a uniformly distributed, unique random generated number

Returns:
the generated number
Throws:
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - Thrown if the maximum number of numbers have already been generated.

addInt

public void addInt(int v)
            throws java.lang.Exception
Adds an integer to the list of already generated numbers

Parameters:
v - integer to add
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - Either if maximum numbers of numbers has already been generated, or the number specified has already been generated or the number is larger than the size

undoLastAdd

public void undoLastAdd()
Undo the generation of last random number. The previous operation called should be 'addInt()'

removeInt

public int removeInt()
              throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
Gets a uniformly distributed, random number from the already generated numbers, and makes this number available for future generation i.e. it is put back into the pool of random numbers that can be generated

Throws:
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - Thrown if no number has yet been generated

removeInt

public void removeInt(int v)
               throws java.lang.Exception
Removes an integer to the list of already generated numbers, hence making it available for future generation i.e. it is put back into the pool of random numbers that can be generated

Parameters:
v - integer to remove
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - Either if the number specified has not already been generated (same if no number has been generated yet) or the number is larger than the size

undoLastRemove

public void undoLastRemove()
Undo the putting back of the random number into the pool of available numbers. The previous operation called should be 'removeInt()'

peek

public int peek()
         throws java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException
See a random number out of the numbers that have already been generated.

Throws:
java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - If no number has yet been generated

size

public int size()
Get the number of 'numbers already generated'
